result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Cervantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.  Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges. To be paid through collection by DOC frm 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Not to possess weapons.
No contact with John C. Department has discretion to modify this order.

Cooperate with the department and with any treatment deemed necessary.
Complete cognitive intervention program.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession; voting.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Daniel Cervantes in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Daniel Cervantes in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Count 2:  dismissed and read-in
Count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
 Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-Possess no weapons
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary
-No contact with John C depart has discretion to modify this order
-Complete cognitive intervention program
-Seek and maintain full time employment
restitution set at zero
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Daniel Cervantes not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Cervantes in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Daniel Cervantes in custody.  Dennis Murphy for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Misdemeanor Warrant, Filed

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel Cervantes in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Daniel Cervantes in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
